questions.question:
A healthcare company uses Amazon SageMaker to train machine learning models for patient diagnostics.
Due to strict regulatory requirements, they must ensure the security of both their training data and deployed models.
They also need to continuously monitor the model's predictions for accuracy and automatically retrain the model if accuracy declines over time.
Additionally, they must track access to the model and ensure that sensitive patient data is encrypted.
Which combination of AWS services will best meet these security and monitoring requirements? (Choose three.)
options: AWS Secrets Manager to securely store the modelâ€™s hyperparameters
Amazon SageMaker Model Monitor to track the model's prediction accuracy
AWS CloudTrail to log access and actions performed on the model
AWS Glue for encrypting data during preprocessing
Amazon GuardDuty to protect against unauthorized access to the model
AWS Key Management Service (KMS) for encrypting training data and model artifacts
correct_answers: Amazon SageMaker Model Monitor to track the model's prediction accuracy
AWS CloudTrail to log access and actions performed on the model
AWS Key Management Service (KMS) for encrypting training data and model artifacts
